definition: to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
Boston ivy or Japanese creeper (Parthenocissus tricuspidata)
to climb mountains and wade rivers (idiom); fig. to make a long and difficult journey

sentences.english: The three of them plodded up the hill in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 三個人在雪中一步一彎腰地爬山。

sentences.english: The old man faltered as he climbed the hill.
I can't go hiking with you this weekend - I have to look after my kid.
sentences.chinese: 這週末我不能跟你們一起去爬山了，我要看孩子。

sentences.english: We plan to go mountain-climbing, could you give us some suggestions?
sentences.chinese: 我們打算去爬山，你能給我們一些建議嗎？

sentences.english: We tried to discourage him from climbing the mountain without a guide.
sentences.chinese: 我們曾設法勸他在無嚮導的情況下不要去爬山。

sentences.english: We can't climb mountain in fog.
Before climbing it is BEST to be properly prepared, in case of any mishap.
sentences.chinese: 爬山之前最好有萬全的準備，以免發生山難。

sentences.english: Being athletic, Tom found the climb quite easy.
sentences.chinese: 由於身體健壯，湯姆覺得爬山很容易。

sentences.english: Sometimes we playedgames or sport or went hiking.
sentences.chinese: 有時我們玩邈遊戲或運動或去爬山。

sentences.english: Boston ivies crawl along the wall.
After climbing the mountain, he aches.
The algorithm reduces mountain climbing steps, and enhances auto-focus speed.
sentences.chinese: 該算法能夠減少爬山步數，可提高自動聚焦速度。

sentences.english: View back to the house across a carpet of Parthenocissus quinquefolia in autumn.
sentences.chinese: 視線穿過五葉爬山虎“地毯”看向秋日的住宅。

definition: to run/to jog/(military) to march at the double
to go uphill/to spin cocoon (silkworms)/to pass away
to go for an outing/to go on an excursion
to take a walk/to go for a walk
to ride (a bicycle, horse, motorbike etc)/cycling/horseback riding/motorbike riding/a ride/CL:次[ci4]
